titleStmt.title: A fragment of Njáls saga : AM 162 B α fol : A digital edition

name.orgName: The Department of Nordic Research, University of Copenhagen

publicationStmt.authority: The Department of Nordic Research, University of Copenhagen

availability.p: License accepted by the editor Katarzyna Anna Kapitan in a mail to Odd Einar Haugen 2016-04-08.

notesStmt.note: This edition was prepared as a part of my MA thesis, in collaboration with "The Variance of Njáls saga" project, at the University of Iceland.

msIdentifier.repository: The Árni Magnússon Institute for Icelandic Studies, Reykjavík, Iceland

msItem.title: Njáls saga
msItem.note: Text corresponding to 7:65-9:20 in the 1875 edition of "Brennu-Njáls saga" (Njála udgivet efter gamle håndskrifter. 1875. Det Kongelige Nordiske Oldskrift-Selskab, Edited by Konráð Gíslason, Eiríkur Jónsson, Förste Bind. Copenhagen: Det Kongelige Nordiske Oldskrift-Selskab).

supportDesc.foliation: in red ink, top right corner
supportDesc.condition: bifolio was preasumbly used as a book-binding

origin.p: This fragment was written in Iceland c. 1390-1440. Date in Kålund’s catalogue: 1400-1500; date proposed in my MA: ca. 1390-1440.

projectDesc.p: This encoding follows the standard set out in The Menota handbook (version 2.0), at http://www.menota.org/handbook.xml as of 2008-05-16.

correction.p: This text has been transcribed directly from photographic colour facsimiles of the manuscript and black and white photographs. Transcription has been checked with the manuscript in situ.

normalization.p: This text has been encoded on three levels: facsimile, diplomatic and normalized. The normalization is based on the standarized Old Norse ortography and follows the edition of "Njáls saga" by Einar Sveinsson, published in the "Íslenzk fornrit" series.

interpretation.p: This text has not yet been annotated.

revisionDesc.change:
2017-01-05
Odd Einar Haugen University of Bergen : (1) Replaced all zeros in "unclear" elements with the dotted circle U+25CC; (2) gave the file version nr. 1.0.2

2016-06-02
Odd Einar Haugen University of Bergen : (1) Changed a number of entities to ordinary Unicode characters; (2) Received an updated file from the editor (with respect to, among other things, the normalisation), checked it, and gave the file version nr. 1.0.1 and the date 2 June 2016

2016-04-14
Odd Einar Haugen University of Bergen : (1) Added the attribute ed="ms" to all "pb" and "lb" elements; (2) Corrected a single instance of a "me:all" element, used as a short-cut for a full "me:punct" encoding

p.note: “þ” is unclear, but probably was used in the top line in purpose to add decorations on the ascender, elswhere spelled with "ꝺ".
An unclear reading, but it seems to be written with &gdlig;
Spelled with “k” to allow scribe adding decorated ascender in the top line, simillar case in "siþan" (1r1).

The abbreviation mark seems be “r” superscript overlapping accent mark of “í”, placed in a wrong position. It has been expaneded as "r" because there is another form “fıarheımtunní” (2r23) abbreviated with superscript “r”, but it could stand also for “ur” as in “dottur” (1v13).
Dittography: "þat uoru ueizlu ſuínar"; additional scribal error in second appearance of sveinar “suínar”.
Scribal error - missing "u" supplied on dipl and norm level.
Scribal error - missing “r” supplied on dipl and norm level.
In this reading cluster “ey” does not look like usual, compare e.g. “saudꝛeyskr” (2v15).
Superscript “a” seems to stand for a single character, rather unusual.
